alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:44PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Goshen and east central Platte Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 444 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Grayrocks Reservoir, or 14 miles east of Wheatland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lingle, Fort Laramie and Fort Laramie National Historic Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.
